member.name: T:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Device
member.summary: Contains all the device functionality of the NI-488.2 driver.
member.remarks: In some cases, callbacks and event handlers are executed in a different thread than the rest of the program. Therefore, you must take special care when accessing objects that have thread affinity, such as UI controls, from these callbacks and event handlers. For more information, refer to Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries.
member.seealso: Events, Callbacks, and Thread Safety in Measurement Studio .NET Class Libraries

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Device.Notify(NationalInstruments.NI4882.GpibStatusFlags,NationalInstruments.NI4882.NotifyCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Notifies the user of one or more GPIB events by invoking the user callback.
member.param: Bit mask of GPIB events to notice.
Pointer to the delegate method .
User-defined reference data for the callback.

remarks.para: If is nonzero, monitors the events specified by , and when one or more of the events is , the is invoked. The only valid mask bits are , , , and . If is set in the notify , and one or more of the other specified events has not already occurred, calls the method when the period has elapsed. If is not set in the Notify mask, the is not called until one or more of the specified events occur.
Notification on is not guaranteed to work if automatic serial polling is disabled. By default, automatic serial polling is enabled.

A device can have only one outstanding call at any one time. If a current is in effect for the device, it is replaced by a subsequent call. An outstanding call for can be canceled by a subsequent call for a device that has a of zero.
If a call is outstanding and one or more of the GPIB events it is waiting on become true, the is invoked.
remarks.note: Notification occurs when the state of one or more of the bits is true. Therefore, if a request is made to be notified when is true, and is currently true, the is invoked immediately.
In Measurement Studio Technology Preview 1, does not work correctly. To work around this problem, call every time after the returns.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Device.BeginRead
member.summary: Initiates a read to a device asynchronously and reads up to bytes of data.
member.returns: An asynchronous result that represents this operation.

remarks.para: addresses the GPIB and begins an asynchronous read of up to bytes of data from a GPIB device. The operation terminates normally when bytes have been received or END is received.

The asynchronous I/O calls ( and ) are designed so that applications can perform other non-GPIB operations while the I/O is in progress. Once the asynchronous I/O has begun, further NI-488.2 calls are strictly limited. Any calls that interfere with the I/O in progress are not allowed and return an exception.
You can receive data from by calling or .

Once the I/O is complete, the application must resynchronize with the NI-488.2 driver. Resynchronization is accomplished by using one of the following methods:
MethodResult
or Blocks current program execution until the I/O completes and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes resynchronization.
The I/O is canceled, the interface is reset, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
The I/O is canceled, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes the driver and application to be resynchronized.
remarks.note: In order to free resources associated with the read, you must always call or after calling , whether in the callback given to or in the same thread of execution where was called.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Device.SerialPoll
member.summary: Conducts a serial poll.
member.returns: Serial poll response byte.
member.remarks:
This method returns the serial poll response byte. If bit 6 (hex 40) of the response is set, the device is requesting service. When the automatic serial polling feature is enabled, the device might have already been polled. In this case, returns the previously acquired status byte.
For more information about serial polling, refer to the Serial Polling Overview in the NI-488.2 User Manual.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.BeginSendCommands(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends GPIB commands asynchronously.
member.returns: An asynchronous result that represents this operation.
member.param: Buffer of command bytes to send.
member.remarks:
This method sends bytes from cmdbuf over the GPIB as command bytes (interface messages). The number of command bytes transferred is returned in the . Refer to the list of IEEE 488 command messages for defined interface messages. Use command bytes to configure the state of the GPIB. Do not use them to send instructions to GPIB devices. Use to send device-specific instructions.
The asynchronous I/O calls ( and ) are designed so that applications can perform other non-GPIB operations while the I/O is in progress. Once the asynchronous I/O has begun, further NI-488.2 calls are strictly limited. Any calls that would interfere with the I/O in progress are not allowed and return an exception.
Once the I/O is complete, the application must resynchronize with the NI-488.2 driver. Resynchronization is accomplished by using one of the following methods:
MethodResult
Blocks current program execution until the I/O completes and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes resynchronization.
The I/O is canceled, the interface is reset, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
The I/O is canceled, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes the driver and application to be resynchronized.
In order to free resources associated with the send commands operation, you must always call after calling , whether in the callback given to or in the same thread of execution where was called.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.AcquireInterfaceLock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire an exclusive lock on the interface for the current process.
member.param: Time period in milliseconds to wait for an exclusive lock.

remarks.para: If a process has acquired a lock, all GPIB calls by that process for that interface occur normally.

If a process has acquired a lock, all GPIB calls (except and ) by other processes for that interface fail immediately and throw . calls by other processes attempt to acquire a lock. The process throws an only after the timeout period has elapsed. throws an , but returns a valid object.
Interface locks are exclusive and are not shareable among processes. If a process has a lock for an interface, no other process can acquire a lock associated with that interface.

A process may acquire multiple (redundant) locks on an interface. The NI-488.2 driver maintains a reference count of the number of outstanding locks per interface and does not unlock the interface until the reference count is 0. If the call is successfulthat is, if it does not return an exception contains the number of locks remaining in effect for the object.

An interface lock is associated with a process and a GPIB interface. An acquired lock remains in effect until the lock is released. Each successful call to acquire a lock should have a corresponding call to release the lock. Calling releases all interface locks held by that process for the interface described by the object.
A of 0 specifies a 0 ms wait period. If the interface is locked by another process, returns immediately with . Otherwise, the process acquires the lock and returns.

member.remarks: To determine if a GPIB control line is asserted, first check to see if the line can be monitored by checking , , , , , , , or . If the line can be monitored (the bit enumeration returns a 1), check the corresponding bus bit in . If the bus bit is set (1), the corresponding control line is asserted. If the bit is clear (0), the control line is unasserted.

member.remarks: is used as part of GPIB initialization. It forces the interface to be Controller-In-Charge of the GPIB. It also ensures that the connected devices are all un-addressed and that the interface calls of the devices are in their idle states.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.ParallelPoll
member.summary: Conducts a parallel poll.
member.returns: Represents the status information for each device configured for a parallel poll.
member.remarks:
The interpretation of the status information is based on the latest parallel poll configuration command sent to each device (see also and ). The Controller can use parallel polling to obtain one-bit, device-dependent status messages from up to eight devices simultaneously.
For more information about parallel polling, refer to the Parallel Polling Overview in the NI-488.2 User Manual.

member.summary: Monitors the events specified by mask and delays processing until one or more of the events occurs.
member.param: Bit mask of GPIB events to wait for.
member.remarks: If is , returns immediately with the updated status returned in . This call is identical to . If is set in and one or more of the other specified events have not already occurred, returns when the period elapses. If is not set in , the method waits indefinitely for one or more of the specified events to occur. You can configure the timeout period using the property.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.BeginWrite(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes byte data to a GPIB device. This method assumes that the GPIB is already properly addressed.
member.returns: An asynchronous result that represents this operation.
member.param: Buffer that contains the bytes to write.
member.remarks:
This method begins an asynchronous write of count bytes of data from to a GPIB device. This method assumes that the GPIB is already properly addressed. The operation terminates normally when has been sent. The operation throws if the board is not the Controller-In-Charge (CIC), and the CIC sends a Device Clear message to the GPIB. The actual number of bytes transferred is returned in .
The asynchronous I/O calls (, , and ) are designed so that applications can perform other non-GPIB operations while the I/O is in progress. Once the asynchronous I/O has begun, further NI-488.2 calls are strictly limited. Any calls that interfere with the I/O in progress are not allowed and return an exception.
Once the I/O is complete, the application must resynchronize with the NI-488.2 driver. Resynchronization is accomplished by using one of the following methods:
MethodResult
Blocks current program execution until the I/O completes and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes resynchronization.
The I/O is canceled, the interface is reset, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
The I/O is canceled, and the driver and application are resynchronized.
Passing causes the driver and application to be resynchronized.
In order to free resources associated with the write, you must always call after calling , whether in the callback given to or in the same thread of execution where was called.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Waits indefinitely for a previous call to complete.
member.param: An asynchronous result that represents the asynchronous NI-488.2 write operation that you want to end.
member.remarks:
Call this method to wait for completion of an asynchronous write started with . This method blocks execution of the current thread until the asynchronous write that you are waiting on completes.
In order to free resources associated with the write, you must always call after calling , whether in the callback given to or in the same thread of execution where was called.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.ParallelPollConfigure(NationalInstruments.NI4882.Address,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Configures the specified device to respond to parallel polls by asserting or not asserting the GPIB data line.
member.param: Address of the device to be configured.
Data line (a value in the range of 1 to 8) on which the device responds to parallel polls.
Sense (either 0 or 1) of the parallel poll response.
member.remarks:
If equals the individual status (IST) bit of the device, the assigned GPIB is asserted during a parallel poll. Otherwise, the is not asserted during a parallel poll. The Controller can use parallel polling to obtain 1-bit, device-dependent status messages from up to eight devices simultaneously.
For more information about parallel polling, refer to the Parallel Polling Overview in the NI-488.2 User Manual.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.ReadString(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads up to a specified number of string data bytes from a device that is already addressed to talk, using the specified termination method.
member.param: Number of bytes to read.
Description of the data termination mode (STOPend or an EOS character).
member.remarks:
This method reads up to bytes from the GPIB and places these bytes into a buffer. The method reads data bytes until either data bytes have been read or the termination condition is detected. If the termination condition is STOPend, the read stops when a byte is received with the EOI line asserted. Otherwise, the read stops when the 8-bit EOS character is detected. The actual number of bytes transferred is returned in .
This method assumes that the interface is already in its listen-active state and a device is already addressed to be a Talker.
The given only applies for the duration of the call and does not modify the value of any of the object properties.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.ResetSystem(NationalInstruments.NI4882.AddressCollection)
member.summary: Resets and initializes multiple IEEE 488.2-compliant devices.
member.param: List of devices.
member.remarks: Reset and initialization take place in three steps. The first step resets the GPIB by asserting the Remote Enable (REN) line and then the Interface Clear (IFC) line. The second step clears all devices by sending the universal Device Clear (DCL) GPIB message. The final step causes IEEE 488.2-compliant devices to perform device-specific reset and initialization. This step is accomplished by sending the message "*RST\n" to the devices described by .

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.NI4882.Board.TestSystemForDeviceInformation(NationalInstruments.NI4882.AddressCollection)
member.summary: Causes multiple IEEE 488.2-compliant devices to conduct self-tests and returns device-specific information.
member.param: A list of device addresses.
member.returns: A list of test results; each entry corresponds to an address in .
member.remarks: sends the "*TST?" message to the IEEE 488.2-compliant devices described by . The "*TST?" message instructs those devices to conduct self-test procedures. A 16-bit test result code is read from each device and stored in resultlist. A test result of 0\n indicates that the device passed its self-test. Refer to the documentation that came with the device to determine the meaning of the failure code. Any other value indicates that the device failed its self-test. If the method throws an exception, contains the number of services that failed. Otherwise, the meaning of depends on the error returned. If a device fails to send a response before the expires, a test result of 1 is reported, and an or is returned.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.NI4882.GpibException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the NI-488.2 driver returns an error due to invalid configuration states, invalid parameters, and other factors.
member.remarks:
When this API makes calls to the NI-488.2 driver, occasionally, errors occur due to invalid configuration states, invalid parameters, and other factors. When this happens, the errors are exposed through this exception class. To look at the exact error code that the driver returns, refer to .
For a list of all NI-488.2 error codes, refer to the iberr Error Codes and Solutions topic in the NI-488.2 Help. To access the NI-488.2 Help from the Start menu, select StartProgramsNational InstrumentsNI-488.2NI-488.2 Help.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.NI4882.GpibException.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the NI-488.2 driver error code that caused the exception to be thrown.
member.remarks:
Every time the API calls an NI-488.2 driver operation, it checks if the status of the operation indicates an error condition. If an error condition exists, the is thrown, and this error code is set as the error code of the operation in question.
For a list of all NI-488.2 error codes, refer to the iberr Error Codes and Solutions topic in the NI-488.2 Help. To access the NI-488.2 Help from the Start menu, select StartProgramsNational InstrumentsNI-488.2NI-488.2 Help.
member.value: NI-488.2 driver error code causing the exception.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.NI4882.GpibException.ErrorCount
member.summary: Gets a count value that can help you diagnose a specific error.
member.value: Count value that can help you diagnose a specific error.
member.remarks: This error depends on the particular method that throws the exception. Refer to the documentation for the particular method to determine the exact meaning of this value. This property is not used for all errors.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.NI4882.GpibException.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets a complete description of the error that caused the exception to be thrown.
member.remarks: Every time the API calls an NI-488.2 driver operation, it checks if the status of the operation indicates an error condition. If an error condition exists, the is thrown, and this error message gives a complete description of the error that caused the exception to be thrown.
member.value: A complete description of the error that caused the exception to be thrown.
